reviewText: Product received for free\n\nAt $5.5 this is overpriced. The game itself is simple enough. Reminds me of Knuckles from high school. Has trading cards, but I only got about 10 minutes of entertainment out of it. No pain, no game.

reviewText: So I guess there's this weird school game kids play with three coins, hence the name, where you try to flick coins at another kid and score goals between their fingers.  Weird.   Seems ok.

reviewText: Fun from the school time, now it is on game, but the difference is that your fingers do not bleed from the coin, so, i guess its obvious plus.\nthe game has a cards, multiplayer, and nice gameplay that is simple but interesting, espicially to play with your friends!\nI recommend to buy this! :)

reviewText: i can't recommend it because i must be too old to understand it. it didn't speak to me at all. maybe the younger crowd might be able to understand this game. i just know we never had it when i was in school. so im just here for the cards.

reviewText:
Pros:
Pretty good for the price.
A game to play when bored.
It's interesting
It has online multiplayer

Cons:
The music is a bit repetitive. Not bad, but it needs more music.
Needs something to keep you playing, maybe unlockable coins.
Needs leaderboards (Wins, Losses, Goals)

Overall:
Can't complain, especially for the price.

reviewText:
3 Coins At School is a game that I recommend because:
- is a method to banish boredom
- it has trading cards
- it is indie & casual
- it has strategy
- it has multiplayer mode

Enjoy!
